cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles NNE of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the Florida Keys into the eastern/central Gulf of Mexico and toward the central Gulf Coast (AL–MS–eastern LA).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Central Gulf Coast near the Mississippi/Louisiana border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama–Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, Louisiana, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from the western Florida Panhandle to southeast Louisiana with an inland track toward Arkansas/Oklahoma
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (13%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; sustained winds likely below gale force with occasional gusts possible Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minimal surge expected along the upper Texas coast because the forecast track remains east of Port Arthur.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain to Port Arthur Thursday into Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and swells near the Sabine Pass approaches could briefly disrupt pilot boarding and some cargo operations.
